title: Teemo: Active Foraging
body:
Okay okay I have got it. Teemo has been suffering a bit I fell after the latest patch but I have some thing that will make him both more viable and interactive.

R: Noxious Trap [New Effect] When in brush or standing still Teemo forages for mushrooms 2/3/4 times as fast
or
[New Effect] When placed in brush Teemos shrooms last 2/3/4 times as long (call it shroom habitat) 
The first gives Teemo a playstyle choice that allows for mushroom placement in exchange for time the second gives Teemo back some of his map precencess in exchanged for telegraphed shroom positioning

Edit: I was inspired by another post I saw on the matter felt like I should throw some credit his or her way

Habitat for shroomanity?

From what I understand, Riot does't want  {{champion:17}}  to just be the shroom guy. They want him to be useful in team fights / give him the ability to team fight better. So this kind of seems like the inverse of that logic.
The problem is that with the 'arm time' and the ability to destroy them so quickly, the mushrooms are about as useful as a Shaco Box in a teamfight (more damage, weaker CC)

but teemo will never be strong as a team fighter. He has 1 active ability that can contribute to team fights outside of his ult, everthing else is passives.

Personally, riot should make teemo focus **more** on map control and give him improved dueling capabilities so that he can really shine as a solid split pusher

For example, I think riot should swap teemo's passive and his E.

His new passive will scale with level, and retain his current ap ratio's (could even test letting his passive apply to Q as well)

His new E will be a passive/active combo like his W. Passive: after coming out of stealth, teemo gains increased atkspd for X seconds (atkspd boost increases with rank) every AA on an enemy champ with this buff active reduces the cd of his E by Y seconds. Active: Teemo stops moving and instantly stealths. Teemo stays stealthed until he makes another action (attacking, casting spells) If in brush, stealth is not broken by moving, if stealth is broken by moving while outside of brush, stealth takes 1 second before it actually breaks. (let's teemo reposition better, not gonna do wonders for escapes while exposed in lane)

Somewhat based off of what Kile147 said of more bush interactions.... If the shrooms could spread in bushes over time, or simply growing in size to be big enough to cover the entire bush. That'd be awesome and very Satan-like.
I would think he only gets the foraging if he stealths in a bush, but whatever works i guess.

What if there were some fields on map where if teemo puts his shrooms they get different effect?
For example:

* increased shroom damage by 0,2 ap ratio
* 1-2 more ticks of poison
* grevious wounds
* better slow
* 0,5s stun
* bleeding
* taking increased damage by 10-20%

Those fields would be visible only for teemo(s) on both sides. Fields would always spawn in exactly the same places, but their effect would roatate every game, so you just cannot memorize where is certain pool with effect. They'd be coloured depending on effect.

That way teemo could put a shrroom where there's lower chance of enemy champion tresspasing. It's a risky play that from 1 side gives teemo a chance to maximalize usefullnes of shroom, while decreases number of shrooms on casual jungle routers

I think that making Teemo have a unique interaction with the brush is cool, but I was thinking that there could be other cool possibilities too. For example you could make it so that when teemo puts a mushroom in a brush the entire brush becomes the trigger for the mushroom, so that simply walking into the brush would cause the mushroom to go off (the radius would increase to the size of the brush so if you set it off you will get hit). In return for this when teemo traps a brush it has slight toxic miasma effect around it. This would make the trap more easily found in exchange for the extra power. This change would make the bush traps more of herding tools than killers since people would be less likely to stumble into them, but it would also create a new mind game for him to play.
